definitions.definition: the state of being in agreement and working together; the state of being joined together to form one unit

examples.text: a plea for unity within the party
He restored peace and unity in the country after years of civil war.
She brought unity to her people.
The dispute has destroyed unity among the workers.
We aim to promote national unity at a time of crisis.
The party is calling for greater political and economic unity in Europe.
a degree of unity between faculty and students
a leader who gave her people a strong sense of unity

definitions.definition: the quality of looking or being complete in a natural and attractive way

examples.text: the organic unity of Raphael's picture

definitions.definition: any of the principles of classical or neoclassical theatre that limit the action of a play to a single story, day and place

examples.text: the unities of action, time and place

definitions.definition: a single thing that may consist of a number of different parts

examples.text: If society is to exist as a unity, its members must have shared values.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French unite, from Latin unitas, from unus ‘one’.
